contents: Article 3 (Marketing Business) ① The Athletic Association may conduct the following marketing business. 1. Business regarding sponsorship rights A. Determination and adjustment of the scope of commercial rights of sponsors B. Attraction and contracting of sponsors. Implementation, support and management of sponsorship rights of sponsors 2. Business related to commercialization rights A. Determination and adjustment of the scope of commercial rights of the commercialization right holder B. Attracting and contracting with commercialization rights holder. Implementation, support and management of commercialization rights of commercialization rights holder 3. Business related to broadcasting rights A. Determination and adjustment of the scope of commercial rights of broadcasting rights holders B. Attracting and contracting with broadcasting rights 4. Business related to facilities and events that the Sports Council owns or has the right to use A. Selling or consignment tickets to competitions or events hosted by the Sports Council B. Marketing using facilities owned by or authorized to use by the Sports Association. Holding and operating stadium events and related events, etc. 5. Manufacturing and sales business of videos, photos, etc. related to marketing assets 6. Marketing-related business with related organizations A. Joint marketing contracts with related organizations, etc. B. Recruitment of joint commercial rights holders with related organizations, etc. 7. Marketing agency business a. Marketing agency or advisory service for related organizations B. Marketing agency or support for those who have entered into a contract with the Sports Association 8. Business related to registration, protection and management of marketing assets 9. Other businesses deemed necessary by the President of the Sports Association ② The Sports Council establishes a subsidiary to carry out the marketing business under Paragraph 1 ·It can be operated or entrusted to a marketing company by designating it as an agency.
